attributes.action: Provide the nesscesary money to link up the Great Central Railway to the Nottingham Transport Heritge Centre at Ruddington, and extend north to the river trent at Wilford and South to Leicester Abbey, creating an 'Intercity' Steam Railway
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Great Central Railway is based at Loughborough and is 8 miles long, running south to Leicester North. The 5 mile section from Loughborough to Rothley is double tracked, making it unique in the country. The line gets many well known locomotives visiting. The Nottingham Transport Heritage centre ownes 9 miles of track from the NTHC at Ruddington to a siding by the Midland Mainline. We need to get across the MML and over some other obstacles to link up with the GCR, making us one of the longest railways in the UK. Then we can extend north and south, making us an Intercity steam railway
